data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to company, associate, be the friend of or companion to. saahibun (pl. sahbuun and ashaabun) - companion, associate, possessor of any quality or thing, one in an intimate relation with anything, fellow and showing any type of connection or link, helper. saahibatun - spouse, consort, wife. saahaba - to bear company. ashaba (vb. 4) -to preserve, hinder, keep from, defend from. yushabuun - they will be accompanied.
data.sentence: The word أَصْحَابُ comes from the root ص ح ب and is associated with the meanings: to company, associate, be the friend of or companion to. saahibun (pl. sahbuun and ashaabun) - companion, associate, possessor of any quality or thing, one in an intimate relation with anything, fellow and showing any type of connection or link, helper. saahibatun - spouse, consort, wife. saahaba - to bear company. ashaba (vb. 4) -to preserve, hinder, keep from, defend from. yushabuun - they will be accompanied.

data.meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.
data.sentence: The word النَّارِ comes from the root ن و ر and is associated with the meanings: fire, flame, heat, war, light, shine, sparkle, irritate, vex or provoke war.

data.meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.
data.sentence: The word الدُّنْيَا comes from the root د ن و and is associated with the meanings: (Dal-Nun-Alif) To be near, come near or low, let down, be akin to.

data.meanings: It was not; is not. It is one of the verbs of the class of kana which govern the attribute in the accusative. This verb has occurred about 89 times.
data.sentence: The word لَيْسَ comes from the root ل ي س and is associated with the meanings: It was not; is not. It is one of the verbs of the class of kana which govern the attribute in the accusative. This verb has occurred about 89 times.

data.meanings: to eat away, excess, suckle (a child), be ignorant, be unmindful/heedless, exceed the undue bounds or just limits, commit many faults/offences/crimes/sins. asrafa - to squander one's wealth, act immoderately, be prodigal, extravagant, transgress. musrif - one who is wasteful.
data.sentence: The word الْمُسْرِفِينَ comes from the root س ر ف and is associated with the meanings: to eat away, excess, suckle (a child), be ignorant, be unmindful/heedless, exceed the undue bounds or just limits, commit many faults/offences/crimes/sins. asrafa - to squander one's wealth, act immoderately, be prodigal, extravagant, transgress. musrif - one who is wasteful.

data.meanings: to seek, desire, ask, demand, call upon, invoke, ascribe, cry out, call out to, pray, supplicate, petition, require, need, summon, invite, assert, succour. (e.g. 'daAAa' in phonetic search engine).. Adopted son (adiya, pl. of da'iy).. . Da'aa (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He prayed, called.. Du'aa (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They ascribed.. Da'utu (prf. 1st. p. sing.): I called.. Li Yad'u (prt. 3rd. p.m. sing.): Let him call; he might call.. Lam Yad'u (imp. 3rd. p.m.): Did not call us.. Yad'u (imp. 3rd. p.m.): He calls.. Yad'uuna (imp. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They call.. Yad'uu (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing.): Thou call.. Tad'uu (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing.): Thou call.. Tad'uu/Tad'uuna (acc./ imp. 1st. p. plu.): You call.. Nad'u/Nad'uu (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We call.. Ud'u (prt. 2nd. p.m. sing.): Thou call.. Ud'uu (prt. 2nd. p.m. plu.): Call you all.. Du'iya (pp. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He was called.. Du'uu (pip. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They were called.. Du'iitum (pp. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You were called.. Laa tad'u (prt. neg.): Do not call.. Da'uutum (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): You called.. Tud'auna (pip. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You are called.. Tad'uu/Tad'uuna (imp. 3rd. p.m. plu. VIII.): They ask for.. Tadda'uuna (imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. VIII.): You ask for.. Tud'aa (pip. 2nd. p.m. plu. VIII.): You will be summoned.. Yud'aa (pip. 3rd. p.m. sing. VIII.): He will be summoned.. Yud'auna (pip. 3rd. p.m. plu. VIII.): They will be summoned.. Daa'in/Daa'ii (act. pic. m. sing.): One who calls, summons.. Du'aa'un (v.n.): Supplication; prayer; call.. Du'aai (comb.): My prayer; calling.. Ad'iyaa (n. plu.): Adopted son.. Da'watun (v.n.): Call; claim; message; supplication; prayer.. Da'waahum (comb.): Their cry.

data.meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.
data.sentence: The word مَرَدَّنَا comes from the root ر د د and is associated with the meanings: to send back, turn back, reject, refuse, repel, revert, restore, give back, refer, give again, take again, repeat, retrace. maraddun - place where one returns. mardud - restored, averted. irtadda (vb. 8) - to return, turn again, be rendered. taradda (vb. 5) - to be agitated, move to and fro.
